profile_data.summary: Data Scientist with three years of experience in Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing. Proficient in statistical modeling, time series forecasting, and developing GenAI solutions to address complex business challenges.
profile_data.headline: Data Scientist at BMW Financial Services |  Graduate Computer Science student at the University of Cincinnati | Ex-Data Scientist at TCS | PCAP Certified | 4 X Azure Certified

experience.description:
• Employed adaptive Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) on AWS Cloud for the GenAI Titles use case, achieving 95% model accuracy and reducing call handling time by 30%. 
• Pioneered three GenAI use cases on BMW's AI Platform as the first adopter, each containing more than 800 documents, developing scalable training architectures to drive BMW employee adoption. 
• Worked on Agent Orchestration, utilizing tools to integrate multiple IT applications.
• Created dashboard analytics for agent utilization, improving operational efficiency by 25% while ensuring data quality and governance using LLMOps for the industrialization of the end-to-end GenAI application.
experience.title: Data Scientist

experience.description:
•	Developed Python script employing advanced Machine Learning and Time-Series Analysis techniques to generate comprehensive dashboard plots from gearbox sensor data with a Sampling rate of 3000.
•	Boosted sensor data quality and unlocked richer insights by 30% with data cleaning, advanced analysis, and statistical calculations.
•	Created a predictive forecasting model leveraging the Auto_Arima, TimeGPT, and Temporal Fusion Transformers enabling 78% accurate prediction of future plant stoppages based on historical data patterns and trends.
•	Achieved >85% accuracy in particle size analysis for cone crushers using a novel image processing system with a modified DexiNed network. This system leverages edge detection, contour refinement, and mass estimation techniques.
experience.title: Data Scientist

experience.description:
•	Created and executed ETL processes with SSIS, enhanced by Apache Hive for optimized data querying and storage management on Hadoop clusters. Developed SQL transactional queries for stored procedures, enhancing data reliability.
•	Combined Apache Spark with Hadoop to manage large-scale data processing more efficiently. Produced actionable, client-facing reports using SSRS and Power BI, meeting intricate business needs and aiding stakeholder decision-making.
experience.title: Programmer Analyst Intern

engagement by 50%.

projects.description:
• Engineered an advanced question-answering chatbot using LangGraph, LangChain, and RAG with researcher, supervisor, prompt enhancer, and validator 
nodes, improving accuracy by 35%. 
• Integrated chunking, embedding, and similarity search pipeline with FAISS, enabling seamless information extraction from PDFs, Docx, Txt files, and 
websites, reducing manual effort by 40%. 
• Optimized PostgreSQL query management and Dockerized the solution, improving performance.
projects.title: AI Multi-Agent RAG Based Chatbot

member.occupation: Data Scientist at BMW Financial Services | Graduate Computer Science student at the University of Cincinnati | Ex-Data Scientist at TCS | PCAP Certified | 4 X Azure Certified

projects.description:
* I have utilized LSTM architecture for enhanced sequential data processing, facilitating the model's ability to capture long-term dependencies.
* I have implemented One-hot Encoding to represent words as vectors, aiding in the creation of dense, semantic embeddings for input sequences.
* I have employed pre-padding to ensure uniform sequence lengths, optimizing computational efficiency and model performance during training.
* I have conducted N-gram Analysis and WordCloud generation to visualize word frequency and distribution patterns, aiding in feature extraction and data understanding.
* I have leveraged both LSTM and Bidirectional LSTM models for comprehensive context understanding, capturing information from both past and future states of input sequences.
* I have applied stop words removal and Lemmatization techniques to preprocess text data, reducing noise and standardizing word forms for improved model accuracy.
projects.title: Fake News Classifier Using LSTM

member.occupation: Data Scientist at BMW Financial Services | Graduate Computer Science student at the University of Cincinnati | Ex-Data Scientist at TCS | PCAP Certified | 4 X Azure Certified

projects.description:
• Cloned YOLOv5 and Image data repository for Number Plate Detection from, utilizing ElementTree to parse XML files, extracting vital information like image details and bounding box coordinates for analysis.
• Employed TensorFlow for image processing, reading, resizing, and conversion into arrays, followed by normalization operations.
• Determined the center of the number plate using diagonal coordinates from the bounding box and trained the YOLOv5 model, enhancing accuracy through pre-trained weights.
• Applied confidence and probability thresholds, executing non-maximum suppression to refine results. 
• Extracted Region of Interest (ROI) from detected bounding boxes.
• Applied pre-trained PyTesseract OCR model, using Image_to_string method to extract text information from Number Plate Detection project's Region of Interest (ROI).
projects.title: Automatic Number Plate Detection Using Yolo and Pytesseract

member.occupation: Data Scientist at BMW Financial Services | Graduate Computer Science student at the University of Cincinnati | Ex-Data Scientist at TCS | PCAP Certified | 4 X Azure Certified

projects.description:
• Developed a machine learning model for early-stage Alzheimer's disease detection using the Oasis 
Longitudinal dataset and conducted exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand the dataset.
• Performed data preprocessing, addressing missing values, label encoding, and standardization. 
Implemented dataset split and hyperparameter tuning with RandomizedSearchCV.
• Utilized a variety of machine learning models, including ensemble algorithms (Random Forest, Gradient 
Boosting, Adaptive Boosting), Logistic Regression, and Decision Tree models and evaluated model 
performance by considering precision and recall as key evaluation.
• Designed an interactive website with HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap and integrated it with the machine learning 
model using the Flask framework.
projects.title: Detection Of Alzheimer’s Disease Using Machine Learning

member.occupation: Data Scientist at BMW Financial Services | Graduate Computer Science student at the University of Cincinnati | Ex-Data Scientist at TCS | PCAP Certified | 4 X Azure Certified

projects.description:
- Conducted Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) to gain insights into the dataset for Heart Failure Detection using Artificial Neural Networks (ANN).
- Employed various data visualization techniques, including count plots, box plots, distplots, heatmaps, and pairplots, to understand and represent key patterns and relationships in the data.
- Utilized Interquartile Range (IQR) analysis to identify and address outliers in the dataset, ensuring data integrity.
- Developed an automated code for handling outliers, streamlining the preprocessing phase for enhanced model robustness.
- Applied MinMaxScaler to normalize and standardize the input features, optimizing the ANN's performance.
- Created a sequential model with dense layers to construct the neural network architecture for heart failure detection.
- Implemented Early Stopping to halt training when the model's performance plateaued, preventing overfitting and improving efficiency.
- Incorporated dropout layers to enhance model generalization and reduce the risk of overfitting during training.
projects.title: Heart Failure Detection Using ANN

member.occupation: Data Scientist at BMW Financial Services | Graduate Computer Science student at the University of Cincinnati | Ex-Data Scientist at TCS | PCAP Certified | 4 X Azure Certified

projects.description:
- Developed a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) for image classification in a project involving dogs and cats.
- Implemented Min-Max Normalization to scale and standardize input data, optimizing the model's performance.
- Applied pooling techniques to downsample feature maps, enhancing the efficiency of the CNN.
- Demonstrated the significance of Rectified Linear Unit (ReLU) activation function in CNN for better model training and performance.
- Utilized flattening techniques to convert multi-dimensional data into a one-dimensional array, facilitating effective neural network processing.
- Integrated callbacks to enhance training efficiency by monitoring and responding to model performance during training.
- Leveraged ImageDataGenerator to augment and diversify the training dataset, improving the model's ability to generalize to new data.
- Monitored and analyzed both training and validation errors to ensure model accuracy and generalization capabilities.
projects.title: Image Classification using CNN

member.occupation: Data Scientist at BMW Financial Services | Graduate Computer Science student at the University of Cincinnati | Ex-Data Scientist at TCS | PCAP Certified | 4 X Azure Certified

projects.description:
- Implemented data manipulation, analysis, and visualization using Python libraries such as pandas, numpy, and matplotlib for effective handling and exploration of the airline passenger dataset.
- Executed time series analysis techniques, including data preprocessing and exploratory data analysis (EDA), to gain a comprehensive understanding of the dataset's structure and characteristics.
- Applied decomposition methods using statsmodels to break down time series data into observed, trend, seasonal, and residual components, enabling deeper insights into underlying patterns.
- Conducted stationarity checks utilizing the Augmented Dickey-Fuller (ADF) test and automated the stationarity conversion process by developing a function that iteratively differed the data until achieving stationarity.
- Successfully split the time series dataset into training and test sets, ensuring the proper separation of historical and future data for model development and evaluation.
- Utilized the pmdarima library to automate the selection of SARIMA model parameters based on minimizing the Akaike Information Criterion (AIC).
- Implemented the fitting of SARIMA models to training data, demonstrating proficiency in model development and optimization.
- Applied the trained SARIMA model to make accurate predictions on the test dataset, showcasing competence in forecasting future values.
- Evaluated model performance using metrics such as mean squared error (MSE), root mean squared error (RMSE), mean absolute error (MAE), and mean absolute percentage error (MAPE) to ensure robust forecasting results.
- Demonstrated adaptability by retraining the SARIMA model with the entire dataset, emphasizing a commitment to ongoing model improvement and preparation for future forecasting challenges.
- Executed effective visualization techniques to present forecasting results alongside historical data, enhancing communication of complex analyses to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
projects.title: Univariate Time Series Analysis
